headline: Technical leader, systems engineer, programmer, mentor, and large-scale enthusiast
about: I am a passionate engineer, strategic senior-level technical leader, programmer, and architect that draws from over 20 years of experience in the industry. I have a deep passion for programminmg, and automation, and thrives in working on complicated technical projects.
topSkills: Cloud Computing • Amazon Web Services (AWS) • DevOps • Docker Products • Linux

experience.position: Head of Platform Operations; Staff Architect
experience.description: Genesis member of the Platform Operations team. Built Platform Operations team, guided culture, mentored team members, and played critical key role in migrating legacy platform running on Heroku to AWS and EKS.
Worked in DevOps to improve CI/CD pipeline performance, and Kubernetes scaling. Tools work to improve ops/engineering velocity.

Worked in the tools/infra org, and was responsible for managing an internal Flask dashboard/tool application. Supported several projects running in AWS, and used SQS/SNS, CloudWatch, DynamoDB, EC2, R53, Lambda, and S3. Wrote tooling and libraries to help in the daily operations of our team, and mentored others in Python.

Responsible for providing input and guidance to the PD teams to facilitate a stable and scalable product (QBO). I received several awards for my leadership, and technical abilities while in this role.

Designed and built a complete replacement of QBO's legacy monitoring solution. Leveraged Nagios, and custom templating and meta-configuration files to rapidly create the environment. This allowed QBO to go from a reactionary mode with no trending and using multiple monitoring solutions to a single solution that had consistent, actionable and useful alerts. I took the iniative to train level-1 techs in the NOC to handle many alerts to reduce the load of the on-call engineer.

Created a object-based platform using in PHP and MySQL. This tool keeps temporal state of the production environment in a database so that it can be programmatically queried later on. This tool includes a framework that I wrote that allows for rapid development of tools to do any number of things such as taking action on certain criteria, or trending. Much more powerful tools are of course possible.

Responsible for Quick Books Online (QBO) which included application layer operations such as deployments, project planning, problem tracking and resolution, and capacity planning. Worked closely with the development team to help improve overall quality of the service.

Played the lead role when QBO was attacked by a world-wide phishing scam. I worked directly with the networking, corporate security, and customer service teams to directly decide and guide how to mitigate the threat. My role in this earned me a recognition award for my involvement.

Responsible for one of the top destinations at Yahoo! (Yahoo! OMG). This includes all aspects of the site, and meeting existing SLA standards for both site performance and availability. At peak, omg.yahoo.com would get in excess of 7k requests a second, which would put significant strain on the database back end, the API, and multiple caching layers.

Responsible as the primary engineer for numerous second-tier properties such as Yahoo! Star Wars, Yahoo! Entertainment, and Yahoo! Shine. This included working with development engineers and managers to analyze site performance before major releases, and for troubleshooting issues related to SLA misses.

Launched Yahoo! Star Wars (Worlds)- This included all aspects of project management, including obtaining hardware by justification of site performance expectations, as well as working with many groups (site ops, net ops, etc.) to ensure goals are met based on established project plan. Later, worked with the transition of the site's maintenance to our counterparts in Bangalore India

Was responsible for doing a detailed analysis and reporting on the feasibility of implementing a massive Squid caching layer in front of the entire storage farm to improve performance, and reduce load on the back-end. Work included doing a size distribution of 10's of millions of cacheable objects, as well as their request frequency. After this, determining number of required systems to achieve a significant level of performance, and creating a roll out plan for bringing it live.

Implemented a multi-tiered Nagios installation using a completely custom roles based administration tool (I wrote it in Perl) to manage 2.5k nodes, and 25k active service checks. The design allowed for dynamic slave allocation based on increased usage, and was responsible for finding limits with Nagios 2.6's design, and worked with Ethan (Nagios creator) to improve performance.

Was the primary administrator for their 4 PB multi-tiered "HSM" NAS storage environment that was receiving 2.5TB of data a day. Work included debugging file corruption issues, and NIS issues with mounting the filesystems.
Responsible for the production environment and SAN networks that serves our website, it's databases, and back end operations for the communication with all of Netflix's distribution hubs.

Responsible for the 24/7 upkeep of the entire Solaris/Linux production environment. This includes all DMZ hosts (web servers, smtp gateways, etc.) as well as the lab farm, and internal core corporate infrastructure Unix systems. Total systems under my responsibility were greater than 200.

Was the architect and project manager for the trans-data center relocation of our two external websites and all equipment. Responsible for planning the relocation and outage of the entire lifecycle from scoping, to development and testing, to completion. This project had extremely high visibility amongst senior management and was the highest project to be completed by the company. Accomplishments included:

Achieved an "outperform" rating from the Director of IT by bringing everything online in less than 24 hours- the target goal was 48 hours.
Was the coordinator between different departments including networking, facilities, and application delivery to ensure that project deadlines were met, and dependencies were resolved.

Planned the data center floor plan layout- considered power/HVAC requirements to ensure reliable service, and efficient rack layout (given limited space) to allow maximum growth to reduce the risk of moving equipment in the future.
Achieved no downtime (some decreased functionality though) by forcing a split brain in the HA environment, applications affected included Apache, Oracle, and Weblogic.

Was the architect for a centralized email processing system to improve efficiency of analyzing emails sent by the 2000+ production systems. Due to the variety of emails received, this helped reduce overlooking key important notifications, and reduced the amount of time spent perusing the emails significantly.

Was the architect and builder of a RedHat Linux kickstart server to aid in building new Linux cluster nodes. I leveraged the PXE standard, and dynamic DNS (found in Bind 9, and ISC DHCP 3.x) to allow systems to be rebuilt just from the network card (not needing a CD or a floppy). This allowed for rapid build out of new machines in anticipation of increased cluster processing needs.

During the potential sale of Riffage, a due diligence crew came and evaluated the production and corporate infrastructure that I designed and built. The president of Riffage told me that the crew rated my design as one of the top of about 20 companies that they reviewed over a two-month period.

Was the architect and developer of a fully automated file processing system that was capable of operating over a LAN or WAN, and also designed to be clusterable across heterogeneous Unix machines. This program operated continuously for over a year until a newer version replaced it (which I also wrote).

Was the systems architect that designed and implemented the corporate network and server environment (which had greater than 50 nodes and 15 servers), which included OpenBSD, Linux, and Solaris 2.6 to 8.

Designed and implemented the corporate mail system, and production Bind DNS servers (including satellite offices). The mail system included a specialized mail gateway that filtered both incoming and outgoing mail using a custom PCRE based filter essentially making the company immune to popular mail viruses such as the "Ilove you" virus and variants.

Was the systems architect that designed the security policies that controlled access in and out of the facility. This includes firewall design, access controls, and implementation of operating system policies to ensure a highly secure environment.

Wrote a program called mp3_check that is playing a pivotal role in the quality of the music files available of the website. After being made publicly available, there have been over 8,000 downloads of the program, and I frequently get kudos from people around the world. The page for the program is located at freshmeat.net. People use it from satellite transmission processing, to extraction of MP3s from Shockwave Flash files.

Was the architect and developed all of Diamond Multimedia's Online Store, including the customer interface, database schema, transaction system, and the administration back-end.

Maintaining enterprise databases (Microsoft SQL Server, and Oracle), supporting developers in a Unix development environment under Solaris 2.5.1 and 2.6, and developing applications for online/Internet related purposes.

Created an enterprise level WAN based e-commerce data exchange system that provided a critical function in managing shipments of huge quantities of Rio MP3 Player product to third-party distribution centers nationwide.

Created an online HTML page generation system used to build static pages for certain high-load areas of the production website.

Created an HTML based mass emailing system (subscription based) used by Diamond Multimedia for direct marketing.

Created intranet-based reporting tools for measuring e-commerce and direct marketing results of mailings and promotional specials on the online store.

Created an extranet for field engineers, allowing secure access to current product information, including features such as automatic email notifications of changes and threaded discussion forums.

Developed an FTP/HTTP staging server for web development, including a tiered security model, automatic notification of files checked-in for quality-assurance, automated data-replication of approved files to production servers.

headline: Information Security Professional
about:
At Undisclosed, our team leverages my expertise in cybersecurity incident response and security monitoring to protect our information assets. With a Master's degree in Computer and Information Systems Security/Information Assurance, I champion a proactive defense against digital threats.

My leadership fosters a resilient digital environment through robust security protocols and a culture of security awareness. By integrating people, processes, and technology, we empower our organization to navigate the cybersecurity landscape confidently, always prioritizing the alignment of our IT solutions with business objectives.

publications.title: Wide gain bidirectional converters for energy storage system of fuel cell vehicles
publications.description: Fuel-Cell Vehicles have gained reasonable popularity for its low emission, long driving range, and eco-friendly features. A converter of bi–directionalpower flow stands between the energy management system and the dc bus connected to the load through the inverter. Many converter topologies have been proposed for FCVs can be observed in the Electric vehicle market. Hence, there is a need of assessment of the popular topologies of the bidirectional DC-DC converters required to judge. This paper presents analysis and simulation studies between two converter topologies which employ inherent soft switching technique and set forth the suitable performance observed in PSIM 9.0 simulations.

publications.title: Analysis and Design of Discharging Circuit for Auxiliary Battery Systems in EVs
publications.description: This paper deals with designing a simulation model of test setup for deriving information for analyzing the discharging characteristics of a battery in accordance with a predefined discharging profile. As an initial step, in order to determine the parameters from the discharging circuit, the requirements of the batteries were collected. A DC-DC boost converter of 4 kW input power and maximum input current of 100 A is designed for discharging the source battery in a controlled manner using PI controller. From a variable input voltage, boost converter is able to step-up the input voltage to a higher constant dc output voltage using feedback technique. The resistive load is used initially and later the dc motor load is used as a variable load. The constant output voltage of 50 V is obtained. The simulation is done using MATLAB/ SIMULINK.

headline: GC-EAD holder-Automation ( EMS, BMS, PLC, DCS, SCADA & HMI ) & GxP App and instrument SME (Emerson DeltaV, Aveva-OSI-PI/MES, Labware/LabVantage LIMS, Waters ELN/SDMS/LMS/Empower, Biovia ELN & (Dassault) LES,Chromeleon )
about:
Summary:

As a dedicated and experienced SME in Automation and GxP Applications & Instrumentation with extensive experience in implementing, optimizing, and maintaining mission-critical systems within regulated life sciences and pharmaceutical environments. My expertise spans a broad range of industry-leading platforms, including Emerson DeltaV, Aveva-OSI PI/MES, LabWare/LabVantage LIMS, Waters NuGenesis ELN/SDMS/LMS/Empower, Biovia ELN & Dassault LES, Thermo Fisher Scientific Chromeleon, and Rockwell & Wonderware systems.

With a deep understanding of automation, data integration, and compliance standards, I specialize in bridging the gap between business needs and technical solutions, ensuring operational excellence while adhering to strict GxP and regulatory requirements such as FDA 21 CFR Part 11.

Key Expertise:

Automation Solutions: Proficient in configuring and managing advanced process control systems like Emerson DeltaV for automated manufacturing and process optimization.

publications.title: Secure internet access
publications.description:
Citrix Secure Internet Access (CSIA) is a cloud-based solution that enables secure remote access to online and SaaS applications. It includes a secure web gateway, a cloud access security broker, malware protection with sandboxing, intrusion detection and prevention systems, and data loss prevention. Along with SDWAN and Secure Workspace Access, Citrix Secure Internet Access is a cornerstone of Citrix’s fully integrated Secure Access Service Edge (SASE) solution.

Citrix Secure Internet Access allows safe access to online and SaaS applications both within and outside the Citrix Workspace, regardless of the user’s location. It adds an additional layer of protection to Citrix Workspace users and integrates with Citrix SDWAN to provide a fully integrated Citrix network and security solution.

headline: CTO: Holistic enterprise wide discovery and classification at scale to achieve Data Aware Security and Privacy
about:
As a passionate proponent of data security and machine learning, I collaborated with like-minded partners to create a new technology that constantly monitors network changes in the usage of personal data, thereby , delivering the most up-to-date catalog of personal data usage in the market.
 
At 1touch.io, we’ve built a talented team committed to mitigating privacy and security risk in the enterprise by using network analytics to create a holistic view of customer data usage.
 
What exactly do we do?
1. IT Security & Risk Management value driver
2. Security Operations and Incident Response value driver
3. Privacy Management and Compliance value driver
 
Over time, we’ve observed how CISOs and other leadership teams leverage visibility into personal data to meet their MBOs. This motivates us to solve deeper business problems. 
 
CISOs are amazed at the level of information they can now see. They gain a level of visibility they have never had before, which helps them prove their value within their organizations and gives them relevance at the board level.
 
My passion for leveraging network and security big data analytics and Network Analytics to drive enterprise business value, has only increased over time, in large part due to the presence of committed and talented team members around me.
 
I also take pleasure in the opportunity to work with some of the brightest CISOs and other Security and Compliance leaders in the industry.
 
I love staying up-to-date on Network Analytics, Data Privacy, and Machine Learning topics, and discussing their role in driving business value.
 
I enjoy connecting with innovative minds in this space. If you share my passions for Network Analytics, Data Privacy, and Machine learning, let’s connect and meet for a virtual coffee.
 
When I'm not solving data, privacy, and risk challenges, I enjoy spending time diving, cooking, and enjoying other culinary pursuits.

headline: Organizational psychologist, Stanford faculty, New York Times bestselling author, and speaker. Eight books including Good Boss, Bad Boss, The No Asshole Rule, and Scaling Up Excellence. Latest:The Friction Project.
about:
Robert Sutton is an organizational psychologist and New York Times bestselling author.  He is author of eight books, including (with Huggy Rao) "The Friction Project: How Smart Leaders Make the Right Things Easier and the Wrong Things Harder." He studies leadership, organizational change, innovation, scaling, and workplace dynamics. At Stanford, he is Professor of Management Science and Engineering (emeritus) and a faculty fellow at the Center for Advanced Study in the Behavioral Sciences. He co-founded the Stanford Technology Ventures Program, Institute of Design (“the d school”), and Center for Work, Technology, and Organization. 

Sutton speaks on friction in organizations, other challenges of leading at scale, and fundamentals of modern leadership. To book him, contact Charlotte Perman at United Talent Agency at perman_c@unitedtalent.com or 212.647.6307. 

Sutton won the Eugene L. Grant Award for Excellence in Teaching, and numerous other Stanford teaching awards.  He won awards for the best paper of the year in the Academy of Management Journal and in the Academy of Management Review.  Sutton was named as one of 10 “B-School All-Stars” by BusinessWeek, “professors who are influencing contemporary business thinking far beyond academia.” The London Business School honored him with the Sumantra Ghoshal Award for Rigour and Relevance in the Study of Management. 

Sutton has published over 200 articles in academic and popular outlets.  His books include"Hard Facts, Dangerous Half-Truths, and Total Nonsense" (with Jeff Pfeffer),  selected by the Toronto Globe and Mail as the best business book of 2006. "The Knowing-Doing Gap" (with Pfeffer) was chosen for Jack Covert and Todd Sattersten’s "100 Best Business Books of All Time."  Fast Company's Bill Taylor described "Weird Ideas That Work" as "the smartest and most original take on leadership and organizational creativity that I’ve read." Sutton's "Good Boss, Bad Boss" and "The No Asshole Rule" are New York Times and Wall Street Journal bestsellers. Scaling-Up Excellence (with Rao) is a Wall Street Journal bestseller and Financial Times picked it as among the best six management books in 2014. 

On "The Friction Project," Adam Grant wrote: “This is the ultimate guide to diagnosing and fixing the problems in your organization. No one knows more about making work better than this pair of experts, and they’ve produced a remarkably insightful, engrossing, evidence-based, and actionable read. If every leader took the ideas in this book seriously, the world would be a less miserable, more productive place.”

experience.position: Professor Emeritus of Management Science & Engineering
experience.description: I served as a tenure track professor at Stanford for 40+years, tenured for 34 years. In my new role, I continue write and learn from my Stanford colleagues, work with Stanford students, and teach both Stanford students and executives. And I help a bit with administrative stuff.  But I am more focused on work with people and organizations outside of my Stanford department.

Tenure-track faculty member at Stanford for 40+ years.  Untenured assistant professor from 1983 to 1989. Tenured associate professor from 1989 to 1992.  Tenured full professor from 1992 to 2023. Professor Emeritus (in Management Science & Engineering) from 2024 to present.

I am a New York Times bestselling author of eight books, including The No Asshole Rule, The Knowing Doing Gap (with Jeff Pfeffer), Scaling Up Excellence (with Huggy Rao), and Good Boss, Bad Boss. My new book, The Friction Project: How Smart Leaders Make the Right Easier and the Wrong Things Harder (with Huggy Rao), which published in January of 2024. Note only only The Friction Project was published by St. Martins.  My other books were published by other houses. I have also written perhaps 200 articles for media outlets including Harvard Business Review, Washington Post,New York Times, Wall Street Journal, and LinkedIn and academic journals including Administrative Science Quarterly, Academy of Management Review, Academy of Management Journal, and Journal of Applied Psychology.

I do keynote speeches, especially on my books The Friction Project and Scaling Up Excellence, and the related topics on leading at scale and the fundamentals of modern leadership. Here's my speakers page https://www.utaspeakers.com/speaker/bob-sutton

headline: Fractional CxO | Startups, NASDAQ, and Consortia.
about:
Most startups and mid-size companies struggle to hire and expand their leadership team. They either hire junior executives who can't deliver results or invest in an expensive full-time CxO before they are ready.

As a fractional CxO with 30+ years of experience, I provide executive-level strategy and leadership to high-growth businesses without the full-time cost. I've led global teams for several startups and NASDAQ companies, driving product development and market introduction of complex and paradigm-changing solutions. 

•	Scaled startups to 100+ teams within one year, demonstrating rapid growth and market penetration.
•	Raised over $100M in venture funding across Seed to C-round stages.
•	Launched new businesses, leading large teams and establishing strategic partnerships worldwide.
•	Successfully mentored and guided multiple startups, fostering innovation in emerging technologies.

I offer expertise in general management, corporate strategy, specification of new products, marketing, business development, and venture financing. I focus on autonomous vehicles, industrial IoT, and broadband networking.

Let’s connect to explore how I can help transform your organization through strategic innovation and sustainable growth.

about:
I’m Susan Lindeque, Founder & CEO of Avestix Group and Co-Founder & CEO of BANX, a woman-led force torching the decayed foundations of finance, banking, and wealth creation. 
My story begins in the vast, rugged landscapes of South Africa, where the rhythm of the land taught me resilience and the value of vision. In Silicon Valley, I found my crucible. Here, where ideas collide and the future is coded in real-time, I saw the potential to rewrite the rules of wealth. 

I lead Avestix, BANX, and the Avestix Fortuna—Women Empowerture Network to unleash world-shattering technologies—AI, Blockchain & Quantum finance—that obliterate barriers and fuse wealth with wellness.

With 35+ years across three continents, I’ve raised and managed over $1B in real estate, equity, and venture capital, delivering above average returns for families, institutions, and visionaries. I’m rewiring finance for liberation, banking for user control, and wealth creation for prosperity and purpose. 

Avestix uses AI to smash investment gatekeepers, blockchain for unbreakable trust, and quantum finance for exponential gains.

BANX, our self-custody operating system, is a financial uprising. It annihilates centralized control, arming you with sovereignty over your wealth via AI-driven insights, blockchain transparency, DeFi, and alternative investments. 

We’re crushing AI trust issues, crafting fraud-proof identities, and demolishing systemic barriers, embedding wellness into wealth’s core.

The Avestix Fortuna—Women Empowerture Network, named after Fortuna, goddess of luck and fate, liberates every woman—newborns, elders, widows, those rebuilding—to seize her destiny and make bold financial moves. 

It starts with education: Investing in Yourself, Mastering AI, Embracing Financial Literacy. 
Your Wealth—Your Control.

I host EMPOwerture: Tech Frontiers, a weekly podcast amplifying trailblazers—especially women—exploring blockchain, AI, robotics, cybersecurity, fintech, and quantum finance to forge 2030’s wealth and well-being revolution.

Beyond disruption, I’m obsessed with golf, red wine, Thai massages, and travelling. Travelling keeps me ahead, spotting trends early. In Silicon Valley, Marley, my Labrador, and Senorita, my son’s feisty Frenchie, ground me with their nonconformity. 

My curiosity fuels seismic impact, and I’m devoted to philanthropy, uplifting children with disabilities and women’s financial freedom.

Connect at www.avestix.com or DM me. Serious inquiries only. This isn’t for everyone—and it’s not supposed to be. 

Let’s ignite the unimaginable.

publications.title: Expert Says Family Offices Are Underestimating Cyber Threats—and Leaving Trillions at Risk
publications.description:
Sixty-three percent of financial services firms in the U.S. and Canada reported increased fraud last year, with digital fraud accounting for half of their overall losses.

This may not be surprising given that the International Monetary Fund (IMF) found that “extreme financial losses” for all businesses have quadrupled since 2017 due to cyberattacks.

It’s little wonder then that Lexis Nexis found that nearly half (48 percent) of financial services firms took steps in 2024 to further mitigate fraud, which includes educating consumers and leveraging the “cutting-edge technologies like artificial intelligence, machine learning and biometric- and behavior-based authentication methods” to combat fraud.

Yet one sector in the financial services sector, family offices — firms catering to the investment and wealth management needs of high-net-worth individuals and families — appears to be lagging behind others in the industry when it comes to making the fight against cybercrime a top priority.

Susan Lindeque, CEO of Avestix Group, an alternative investment firm that works with family offices, isn’t entirely surprised to learn that these wealth management firms are operating behind the curve in protecting their organizations from cybercriminals.

“If family offices lack cybersecurity awareness, it may be because the leadership teams in those firms have other priorities,” Lindeque says. “When JP Morgan surveyed family offices, they were asked who was in charge of internal decision-making. More than one-third said CEOs or Presidents. Chief Financial Officers made decisions for 28 percent of the family offices surveyed while Chief Investment Officers were in charge about 25 percent of the time. There was no mention in the study of Chief Information Security Officers or similar cybersecurity-focused roles serving in leadership roles whatsoever.”

headline: Super Connector | helping startups get funding and build great teams with A Players
about:
I founded PeopleConnect in 2000 to help early-stage high-tech companies find the talent they need to succeed. Our clients are in technology, biotech, cleantech, apps, services, medical devices, and consumer products. 

Our team of outstanding recruiters finds C-level executives, talented managers and experienced leaders who will bring our client companies to the next level. We provide traditional contingency searches as well as our one-of-a-kind Employees Without Paychecks program, which I created after the dotcom bust to help promising companies find top-level talent willing to work for equity only until the company gets their funding. 

Other ongoing projects I’m involved in that also support the startup community:

   ● Angel Investor and member of Keiretsu Forum since 2001
   ● Co-founder of Runway Innovation Hub
   ● Creator & Producer of PitchForce
 PitchForce is a weekly pitch event for early stage companies with a panel of establish angel investors and CEO's.

As you can tell by the name of my company, I like to connect people, so please let me know if there is anything I can do for you or information I can share.

experience.description:
I founded PeopleConnect during the dotcom boom to help startups and early stage companies hire key executives to help their companies grow. We place C-level, VP, Director, Manager and other senior roles for companies in tech, biotech, cleantech, medical devices, professional services, consumer products and more. 

To help startups still looking for funding, our one-of-a-kind Employees Without Paychecks program finds key executives who will work for equity for the first few months. 

We’re a primarily virtual company with clients located throughout the country, and we work with a lot of international companies who are looking for leaders to start up or expand their American operations.

The recruiters on my team bring years of top-level recruiting know-how and a commitment to finding the very best person in the least amount of time. They’re supported by sourcers who know which rocks to turn over to find the perfect candidate. Our recruiting process has been refined over the years and it produces great results.

If you are a founder or hiring manager and would like to know more about our services, please email me at max@peopleconnectstaffing.com or ping me here on LinkedIn. I’m happy to answer any questions you might have. 

If you’re a candidate looking for an executive or management role, please check out our job openings here on LinkedIn or on www.PeopleConnectStaffing.com. Your response will go directly to the recruiter in charge of the search.

PitchForce is designed to give startup founders and CEOs a platform to network with panels of VCs and angel investors. These weekly events, alternating between San Francisco & Silicon Valley, are an opportunity to connect and see what experienced investors think of their startup and how it stands up to the competition. I oversee programming, recruit and coach founders, lead marketing and outreach, and host events. 

If you are interested – as a presenter, observer or investor - see www.Pitch-Force.com or http://peopleconnect.eventbrite.com/ for what’s coming up and more information.

Believing that you should put your money where your mouth is, I have been an active angel investor for 12 years, and have worked with countless founders and CEOs to help them refine their presentations and to make the connections they need to build world-class teams.

Runway Innovation Hub, which I co-founded in 2012, is home to innovation, collaboration and awesome startups. I’ve been involved with planning, marketing, events, partnership development, and engaging and selecting new founders and entrepreneurs to join the community. 

For more about Runway, visit www.Runway.is.

Earlier in my career, I was the youngest talent scout in the history of the NBA and Chief Scout for the Phoenix Suns. 

I also built a company that produced sports camps for children and basketball fantasy camps for adults, where I partnered with some of the greatest names in sports including Mickey Mantle, Willie Mays, Pat Riley, Magic Johnson, John Wooden and Billy Casper, to name a few.

projects.title: Minds & Machines 2017 Appathon winning entry
projects.description:
The emergence of distributed renewable power generation capacity across the urban landscape presents a new challenge to power utilities. Micro-generation creates transient pools of capacity that must find available load to consume it. The traditional grid infrastructure is to lossy, to complicated, to focused on centralized generation, in a word, it's inadequate.

Micro capacity is best consumed as close as possible to where it's generated. What if utilities could send the load to the capacity instead of distributing the capacity on a grid? In a few years, cities will be filled with roving autonomous electric vehicles periodically looking for the cheapest recharge opportunity. We propose to harness this mobile "load" to dynamically match localized capacity by predicting micro-capacity and guiding (via price incentives) recharge seeking vehicles to the optimal charging station.

publications.title: Method and apparatus for optimizing hvac systems in buildings
publications.description: A computer based method and apparatus for simulating and optimizing design of an HVAC (heating, ventilation, air conditioning system) in a building. Conventional software tools for this purpose use the well known Navier-Stokes partial differential equations used to describe motion of fluid substances by means of computational fluid dynamics using a finite element method to solve the equations and optimize design of building air ducts for carrying warm and cool air through a building. Instead here the HVAC system is initially simulated using an electrical circuit design tool such as SPICE, where room volumes correspond to electrical capacitances, heat sources correspond to electrical resistances, and air flows to electrical currents in a complex R-C electrical circuit. The goal is to improve energy efficiency in terms of the amount of energy used to heat and cool air, and also the amount of energy used to circulate the air through the air ducts.

publications.title: Concentrating photovoltaic photo-current balancing system
publications.description: A solar cell concentrating apparatus includes a parabolic reflector focusing a beam of light on an array of photovoltaic cells to generate electric current. The photocell array includes a number of triangular shaped segments arranged in a polygon. Surrounding the triangular shaped segments is another set of solar cells, each having a trapezoidal shape. The trapezoidal cells each have a larger surface area than that of the adjacent triangular shaped cell. The electric current produced by each trapezoidal cell is approximately the same as that of the smaller triangular shaped cells, which are subject to more intense incident light due to the beam's Gaussian spot profile.

publications.title: Outsource or Else! How a VP of Software Saved His Company
publications.description:
In Outsource or Else! How a VP of Software Saved His Company, authors Andy Hilliard and Steve Mezak offer a management fable as instructive as it is page-turning.

Jason Jaye is the VP of engineering at ShapeShift, a start-up in Silicon Valley developing cutting-edge fitness technology. When his CEO drops a bombshell that software development for their next product will have to be outsourced, Jason is certain that the product and the company (not to mention he, himself) are doomed. After all, everyone in the Valley knows that outsourcing software development usually equals disaster.

Nevertheless, the fate of ShapeShift rests on Jason s ability to navigate a safe path through uncharted waters. Enter Patrick Delaney, an eccentric, world-traveling outsourcing expert who offers Jason a compass to guide his way: the Seven Keys of Software Outsourcing, a plan for how to successfully select and work with the right global software outsourcing partner. Will Jason help his company meet its goals and bring its exciting new product to market on time? Or will the pitfalls of outsourcing software development swallow him whole before he gets the chance?

Through engaging storytelling, Mezak and Hilliard reveal the secrets of how to choose a software outsourcing partner that:

* Fits your technical requirements and company culture, for optimal results
* Delivers a quality product, at tremendous cost savings, within the needed time frame
* Improves your innovation by leveraging the broader expertise of an offshore team

Outsource or Else! offers useful, practical advice for tech leaders who want to capitalize on the many benefits of outsourcing software development and push their businesses to extraordinary new levels of success.

I am a keynote speaker and advise HR teams and vendors in the HR space, and also serve as an educator, thought leader, and personal coach to HR and business leaders around the world.

projects.title: TIG | In-memory database and distributed process
projects.description:
The project is a distributed alternative to both volatile and non-volatile memory. It is designed to scale or back up your codebase or data. It is built with modern design considerations and offers various features that make it a powerful tool for developers.

Design Considerations

AI and Code Generation: Tig is designed with the understanding that AI generates more code than people and that AI models can apply generic code, making author bookkeeping unnecessary.
Reliability. With more code and less time to verify, reliability and signing each code and data block becomes more important.
Hash Addressing. Tig addresses code with its entire hash rather than a file name, date, or version.
Storage and Consistency. Storage is cheaper, so simple consistency is more important than disk usage.
Change Ordering. It considers serial change ordering obsolete compared as generative AI works on parallel versions.
Stable Codebase. A stable codebase is important, and a hash identifies an entire process memory, not just the difference.
Revisions. Revisions need to be tested and reviewed before use. Who reviewed them is more important than, who wrote them.
Versioning. The stable version is a highly utilized version more likely than the latest one.
Security. We insist on complete isolation. Each session pointed by a root index block is isolated by its unique hash, even if they are run by the same user.
Authentication. Tig uses an API key for security, which can be extended with 2FA wrappers and monitoring solutions.

Features

Backup Tools: Backup tools can directly work with uploaded data easily.
File Addressing: The client can address the file any time with its SHA256 hash.
Data Streaming: Tig is ideal for data streaming workloads as a middle tier.
Distributed Databases: Distributed databases are easy to merge with hash granularity similar to commit sizes.
Temporary Directory: The temporary directory is a good candidate to prevent data leaks.

headline: 🚨Emergency Physician Founder @ evercred automating physician workforce mobility for optimized patient access to care. #HealthTech-AI-Decentralized Identity SME. Physician & Patient Activist-Futurist-Connector
about:
Leah Houston, MD practiced emergency medicine across the United States for nearly a decade before transitioning into entrepreneurship, focusing on physician autonomy and digital privacy. Having worked in 11 health systems across 3 states, Dr. Houston experienced firsthand the significant administrative burdens of the onboarding and credentialing process—an issue faced by physicians everywhere. This inspired her to pursue advanced training in AI and health technology at MIT, culminating in the launch of Evercred, an AI-powered credential data wallet designed to streamline workforce mobility and enhance patient access to physician talent.

Evercred is an AI-driven credentialing automation tool that empowers physicians to become the primary source of ownership and control over their professional credentials, data, and right to work. Our earliest revenue-generating beta version of the physician-facing wallet is now live, allowing physicians to manage and share their credentials effortlessly.

We are also developing an enterprise-facing solution that will enable seamless data sharing and verification through API integrations. This future functionality will provide immediate, permanent, and perpetual primary source verification, revolutionizing how healthcare credentials are managed.

Evercred launched in early 2025 and is now available for paid pilot projects.

To learn more, visit: https://www.evercred.com
topSkills: Decentralization • Artificial Intelligence • Product Development • Healthcare • Identity and Access Management (IAM)

experience.description: Addressing the physician, workforce labor shortage through practitioner centric AI enabled credentialing and identity tools.

HPEC was originally developed to be a decentralized identity and credentialing application for US based physicians which was originally available on the App Store and Google Play. We pivoted to an AI based web app: evercred in February 2025.

If you are a licensed physician in the US get on the waiting list for your invitation today at https://www.hpec.io/

HPEC is restoring privacy and trust to the practice of medicine by first solving the problem of credentialing. The process for physicians to verify their professional identity so they can safely care for patients has been friction filled and cumbersome, until now. HPEC is built on open-sourced self-sovereign identity standards developed by the World Wide Web Consortium and the Decentralized Identity Foundation. Through the HPEC application the physician owns their non fungible credentialing information, and they become the primary source of verification of their identity and credentials. HPEC has a way for physicians to connect with each other and build, own and maintain their professional reputation separate from insurance networks and vertically integrated employment models. HPEC creates a conduit for physician to own and control their digital interactions first with each other, and then with patients and other stakeholders laying the foundation of our future decentralized healthcare ecosystem. 

Learn more at our website https://www.hpec.io/

headline: Founder/CEO at Relay.app | I teach people how to build AI agents
about:
I help businesses of all shapes and sizes use AI to get more done.

I'm currently the founder/CEO of Relay.app, where we're building an easy-to-use platform that enables everyone to create AI agents that work for them.

I also post actionable tips about the latest AI tools. I try to keep my recommendations concise, practical, and honest about what AI can and can't do today.

You'll see a few different types of posts from me:
1. Demonstrations of specific AI agents that you may find useful
2. Stories about my own adventures (and misadventures) with using AI tools
3. Updates on what we're doing at Relay.app

Here's what led me here:
- I started my career as a PhD student in the Multi-agent systems group in the AI Lab at Stanford, where I worked with Yoav Shoham and Dan Ariely on AI applied to product tools.
- I dropped out of my PhD to become the founder/CEO of Timeful, an AI-powered calendar that helped users find time for their tasks, habits, goals and projects.
- After Timeful was acquired by Google in 2015, I became a PM Director at Google, responsible for Gmail, Google Calendar, the Workspace Developer Platform, and more.
- I left Google in 2021 to start Relay.app.

If you're looking for ways to get started with AI, follow me here on LinkedIn or check out the Relay.app YouTube channel: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCIENacxDzvxb7mWIXZRZtAQ.

I'm doing my best to help everyone make the most of AI, and I really appreciate feedback on what I should be talking about more!

experience.description:
Relay.app is a platform to create AI agents that work for you.

AI agents can often be complex to build and unpredictable to use, so we're taking a different approach.

Here's why AI agents in Relay.app are actually useful:

2. Easy-to-understand building blocks and flow charts give you confidence that your AI agent will do what you expect.
3. Human-in-the-loop controls let you double check, correct, and train your AI agent.

If you want to build your first AI agent, Relay.app is the right place to start! Follow me on LinkedIn to learn more.

publications.title: An experimental study on a microclimatic layer of a bionic façade inspired by vertical greenery
publications.description:
A microclimatic layer of the green façade is proven to have specific temperature and flow conditions
on the building envelope. Lower temperatures and wind velocities, and higher relative humidity in the
microclimatic layer are characteristics of vertical greenery systems, which cause lower energy
consumption for the cooling and heating of buildings. Despite innovative architectural solutions, there
are some drawbacks to applying vertical greenery on building envelopes. In this study, a bionic façade
that mimics the positive effects and eliminates the disadvantages of green façades is presented. The
bionic façade consists of bionic leaves, which are made of photovoltaic cells and an evaporative
matrix. A real scale experiment was carried out in the summer to evaluate the potential of the cooling
efficiency of the microclimatic layer and a new photovoltaic cooling technique. The results show good
agreement of the thermal performance of the bionic and green façades and up to 20.8 K lower surface
temperatures of photovoltaic cells, which has effects on the up to 6.6% higher daily electricity yield.

Ashik’s ability to align technology initiatives with the company’s broader goals, coupled with his strong interpersonal skills and commitment to operational excellence, makes him an invaluable leader. His contributions at Marqeta were pivotal in driving both technical advancements and organizational success. Any organization would be fortunate to have Ashik at the helm, driving innovation and team success.

publications.title: The Role of Issuer Processors in the Payments Ecosystem
publications.description: Do you know what happens when during the time you swipe your or debit card and your payments transaction get approved or declined? Who are the parties involved in this whole process? Have you heard of an ever growing modern card issuing space in fintech? Please join us to listen to Ashik Uzzaman, Engineering Manager at Marqeta, who will run us through a brief talk on this exciting world of issuer processors and their part in the payments ecosystem.

publications.title: DB Migration Service: Amazon’s Approach to Change Data Capture (CDC)
publications.description: AWS Database Migration Service (AWS DMS) is a cloud service that makes it easy to migrate relational databases, data warehouses, NoSQL databases, and other types of data stores. You can use AWS DMS to migrate your data into the AWS Cloud, between on-premises instances (through an AWS Cloud setup), or between combinations of cloud and on-premises setups. With support for all major relational and NoSQL databases, DMS is a fitting choice for many data migration projects. In this seminar, we will touch base on Amazon’s choice of designing DMS based on database transaction logs as well as how you can use Terraform for DMS

headline: Co-Founder @ CoffeeSpace | StartX S25 | Ex-World Bank & MIT
about:
I live and breathe being a connector. Whether it’s connecting people to people, people to opportunities, or capital to promising ideas, I love it all. 

It’s a passion I’ve carried throughout my journey with the World Bank, MIT, and as an investor. And it’s also why I'm building CoffeeSpace, the infrastructure for early-stage team formation — starting with an AI-powered platform that connects founders to cofounders and early hires through high-signal matching.

When I’m not working, you’ll likely find me at the gym, analyzing markets, or crafting a new Magic: The Gathering deck. I’m also a proud Coldplay fan—‘Paradise’ and ‘Clocks’ are on constant repeat in my playlist (and probably outplay my next 20 favorite songs combined).

If any of this resonates with you, feel free to connect!

experience.description:
Building the infrastructure for early-stage team formation — starting with an AI-powered platform that connects founders to cofounders and early hires through high-signal matching.

15,000+ users, 1,000,000+ swipes, and 30,000+ matches since launching our mobile app in March 2024. Learn more at coffeespace.com.

Selected for TechCrunch Disrupt 2024’s Startup Battlefield 200 and ranked Top 5 Product of the Day on Product Hunt. Featured in TechCrunch, Tech in Asia, and more.

$1M raised to date from exited founders, YC alumni, and angel investors from Sand Hill Angels, Meta, Google, and other top tech companies. Proud member of Stanford’s StartX Summer 2025 cohort.

StartX is Stanford’s premier founder community and accelerator — with only ~8% of applicants accepted each cycle. It’s home to 2,500+ founders, including the minds behind 18 unicorns and $40B+ in combined company valuations.

This milestone is especially meaningful to us: Stanford-affiliated users make up the single largest community on CoffeeSpace — with over 500 students and alumni (4% of our user base!) already exploring ideas, matching with cofounders, and finding early hires through the platform.

Part of a syndicate of 10 angels from World Bank & IMF investing in early-stage startups (sector- and region-agnostic):
- Arrowster: https://arrowster.com/
- Durioo (YC W22): https://duriooplus.com/
- Kyte: https://drivekyte.com/
- Jibble Group: https://www.jibble.io/ & https://www.payrollpanda.my/
- Products2U: https://products2u.my/
- Ata Plus: https://www.ata-plus.com/
- Grainer: https://grainer.io/
